workflow-instructions.name: initial-business-case
workflow-instructions.overview: Build the initial business case for the venture before the check-in gate. Identify and remove venture killer risks. Create the operating and experiment plan for Phase 6. Establish the pilot customer pipeline.

step.name: reverse-pitch
step.title: Reverse Pitch — Surface Hidden Risks
step.instructions:
Run the "reverse-pitch" brainstorming technique from brainstorming-techniques.csv: 1. Each team member (or persona if solo) argues WHY this venture should be KILLED 2. Collect all kill arguments — the more uncomfortable, the better 3. Group kill arguments into categories (market, competitive, technical, business model, regulatory, team/mothership) 4. Assess each: is this a real risk or a manageable one? 5. Identify the top 5 venture killer risks that require active mitigation
Record all kill arguments in venture-killer-risks.md (Reverse Pitch section).

step.name: risk-registry
step.title: Venture Killer Risk Registry
step.instructions:
Using the venture-killer-risks.md template, build a comprehensive risk registry: 1. Market and customer risks 2. Competitive risks 3. Technical and product risks 4. Business model risks 5. Regulatory and legal risks 6. Mothership and organizational risks
For each risk: likelihood (1-5), impact (1-5), risk score, priority, owner, mitigation action. Identify the Top 5 Venture Killer Risks and assign mitigation owners and deadlines.

step.name: experiment-plan
step.title: Operating and Experiment Plan
step.instructions:
Create the experiment and operating plan for the next phase (Weeks 10-12) using experiment-plan.md: 1. Phase objectives: what must we prove in Phase 6? 2. Experiments to run: landing page test, paid acquisition, outbound/B2B demos, pilot engagement 3. For each experiment: hypothesis, metric, success threshold, owner, timeline, budget 4. KPIs for the plan period 5. Pilot customer pipeline targets 6. Budget and resource requirements 7. Decisions needed from NVB / Sponsor
This plan feeds directly into the check-in pitch.

step.name: pilot-pipeline
step.title: Pilot Customer Pipeline
step.instructions:
Build the initial pilot customer pipeline: 1. Define target account criteria (based on ICP) 2. Identify 15-20 target accounts by name 3. For each: company name, contact name/role, source, status, next action 4. Outreach strategy: what message, what channel, what offer? 5. Pilot structure: what do pilot customers get? What do we get? Timeline? 6. Success metric for the pilot: what defines a successful pilot?
Save pilot pipeline to experiment-plan.md (Pilot section). Update venture-state.yaml with guiding_questions.business_case answers.
